page.title: 17TREW
page.content: This is a small hamlet of twenty one houses. The name is Cornish for{little {hamlet.}It is situated one mile north of the village of Breage. It originated as a mining settlement, the men working in the Wheal Vor tin mine. At that time it had its own pub and meeting house called the{Trelawney {Arms.}Today this is a private house. When a pub local farmers paid their rents and bills in the pub. In the hamlet is a spring which supplied all the local farms and the village of Carleen and Trew itself. The village has a{green }which was thought to be common land but has recently been claimed by the owner of the former Trelawney Arms. Carleen Sunday School annual outing still visits the green and performs a figure of eight dance on it. The significance of this is unknown.
